events.name: Progressive Web Apps Workshop
events.description:
GDG Cluj-Napoca invites you to our first workshop on web technologies. The event will take place at our colleagues from Scoala Informala de IT (the same place where we held Google I/O Extended 2016).

We will build a simple notes web app. The UI will be composed using Polymer components and the notes data will be stored on Firebase.

Agenda:

‚Ä¢¬†18:30-19:00 Time to meet new and old friends

‚Ä¢ 19:00-21:30 Workshop

Requirements:

‚Ä¢ a laptop

‚Ä¢ a Google account for Firebase project

‚Ä¢ Node.js installed or an account on a cloud IDE (ex: Cloud9)

events.name: Google Allo and Duo Podcast
events.description:
We're going to have a podcast talking about the latest Google applications, Allo and Duo.

Allo is a messaging app that makes conversations easier, more productive, and more expressive.

Duo is a one-to-one video calling app for everyone ‚Äì designed to be simple, reliable and fun so you never miss a moment.

Join us and let's have a talk. We're curious to find out what do you think about these two applications

events.name: OpenGDG
events.description: We invite all students from Cluj-Napoca to attend at this meetup where we will talk about involving in open-source projects and getting paid by Google, about contests organized by Google, about our planned workshops etc.

events.name: GDG - Firebase Christmas Lab
events.description:
Google is promoting Firebase in December! A Codelab or a Hackathon will take place globally in every GDG chapter this December. We have swags prepared for everyone who attends and you will get the chance to enter the contest for wining a free ticket to Google I/O 2017!

We invite you to join us at a Firebase Codelab session to improve your knowledge and give you a better chance to win that ticket!

About the speaker:

Sebastian Presecan is co-founder and CTO @ PANGEA and works together with his team at international level projects. Sebi is one of the few developers that can easily talk about mobile, mobile cloud, IDEs, IoT and more. He coordinated developer teams, he developed architectures and complex solutions for which we consider it is an opportunity to meet him and challenge him to share his experience at the Christmas Firebase event.

Agenda:

18:30 - 19:00 reception

19:00 - 21:00 codelab

Target audience:

‚Ä¢ students / developers (level: beginner and mid)

Requirements:

‚Ä¢¬†minimal programming knowledge

‚Ä¢ bring your laptop and install Git, Node.js (with npm) and an IDE/text editor (ex: WebStorm, Visual Studio Code, Sublime etc.)

‚Ä¢ a Google account for creating the Firebase project

events.name: I/O 2017 - Highlights
events.description:
We will meet for discussing highlights from this year's Google I/O that happened between May 17th and May 19th.¬†

We'll have a panel with our members who attended I/O and we'll try to cover the latest news from Google.

events.name: GDG Fresh
events.description:
Are you a fresh student in IT? Do you want to know what professionals in the IT world do, what their challenges are? ¬†Do you what to know the different roads you can follow right from the first year of your studies?

GDG members from Cluj-Napoca want to address these concerns ¬†and help you find your ideal career roadmap.¬†We will be having a panel discussion ¬†with professionals from various career functions and technologies, who will fill you in regarding their career paths and day to day activities.

If this sounds interesting to you, let's meet and discuss.¬†

events.name: Performance of Mobile Apps
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting Doug Sillars, leading mobile developer advocate and evangelist at AT&T. His main focus is on Android/web performance - and how to speed up applications through simple network optimizations.

Doug will present ways to improve the performance of network calls in your app (with a focus on mobile apps and web) by using open source tooling on popular applications in a live debugging session. He'll also present solutions and fixes for network performance that have worked for top companies and can work for you.

You can read more about Doug on his website: https://dougsillars.com and a link to his O‚ÄôReilly book: http://bit.ly/HighPerfAndroidApps

Agenda:
18:30 - Performance of Mobile Apps by Doug Sillars
19:15 - Coffee break / Networking
19:30 - A session of mobile apps presentations
20:15 - Prizes / Networking

Note:
1. We will use the ticket price to buy prizes.
2. If you don't have PayPal account or you have problems with the payment please write us on Meetup or Facebook.

events.name: Google Assistance - Build Actions For Your Community
events.description:
The ‚ÄúBuild Actions for Your Community‚Äù event series is targeted at all levels of developers and we hope to see some great Actions on Google come out as a result and all of you having a ton of fun exploring what you can do with Google Assistant.
We can interact with the google assistant for many reasons: to google search via voice, play music, execute commands, run different apps created by other developers and they can also be integrated with other platforms and devices...and build your own apps!

Agenda
17:00 - 17:30 - Registration
17:30 - 18:15 - Introduction in how to build a Google Assistant
18:15 - 20:00 - Build your Action on Google (app creation)
20:00 - 21:00 - Show your App

Snacks and drinks will be provided!

‚Ä¢ You must bring:
Coding Equipment (Laptop/Phone)

events.name: From Cluj to Google
events.description:
We are proud to organize an event addressed to all that want a career at Google. Our special guests are Bianca Costin and Maria Pascu.

Bianca Costin is one of the founders of Wellcode, an online learning platform where people can learn to code through problem solving. Former Google intern, she's been involved in education for the past 5 years, teaching competitive programming to groups of high school students and getting involved in different other educational activities. She's passionate about developing products that inspire students and help them get the most out of learning.

Maria Pascu is a fresh Google intern, she participated this summer in Google STEP (Summer Trainee Engineering Program) where she worked in the Search team from Dublin, Ireland. In the past she obtains multiple prizes at the National Olympiad in Informatics.

We thank our sponsor, Micro Focus (former HP Software) for hosting this event in their beautiful space.

events.name: Ok Google... start Firebase
events.description:
In this code-lab we will make two apps one with Firebase and one with Google Assistant.

Get hands-on with ML kit. In this workshop, you will learn how to use Firebase ML Kit's text recognition, face detection, and image labeling API's to detect text, identify key facial features, and detect objects in images. See how you can get the information you need to perform tasks like OCR, identifying objects with your phone camera, embellishing selfies and portraits, or generating avatars from a user's photo. The instructors will build the app on Android.

About the speakers:
Attila Bl√©nesi - Senior Android Engineer @ Halcyon Mobile, Speaker Mobile & AI enthusiast
Adrian Muntean - Full Stack developer @ Sector Labs and Ms Student @ Technical University of Cluj-Napoca

Agenda:
18:30 - 19:00 reception
19:00 - 20:00 Exploring AI on mobile with Firebase ML Kit workshop
20:00 - 21:00 Build Actions for Google Assistant (with or without coding)

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Minimal programming knowledge
‚Ä¢ a Google account for creating the Firebase project
‚Ä¢ Bring your laptop and install
- Android Studio - for AI workshop
- Git (https://git-scm.com/downloads)

Note:
1. We will use the ticket price to buy swags and food.
2. If you don't have PayPal account or you have problems with the payment please write us on Meetup (https://secure.meetup.com/messages/?new_convo=true) or Facebook (http://fb.com/gdgcluj).

We thank our sponsor, Micro Focus (former HP Software) for hosting this event in their beautiful space.

events.name: Realtime GraphQL and serverless made easy for Angular with Hasura
events.description:
This is a remote meetup where we will have a presentation about an open source GraphQL Engine called Hasura.

The talk will cover:
- Using GraphQL to make CRUD operations from a Angular application
- Setting up access controls to data
- Building realtime components in Angular using GraphQL Subscriptions
- Wrapping existing REST APIs with GraphQL servers that can be deployed on serverless platforms, and then merging them into a single endpoint using Remote Schemas
- Triggering serverless functions on database events

In short, how Angular developers can adopt realtime GraphQL and serverless using Hasura.

The speaker is Tanmai Gopal, the co-founder of hasura.io and StackOverflow powered fullstack, polyglot developer whose areas of interest and work span react, GraphQL, nodejs, python, haskell, docker, postgres, kubernetes. Also he is the instructor of India's largest MOOC imad.tech with over[masked] students.

This meetup will be live-streamed on YouTube. Those who have RSVP will get the link.

events.name: IWD Cluj-Napoca 2019 (International Women's Day)
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2019 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

Agenda:
19:00 - 19:15 Info about WTM Romania
19:15 - 20:00 The double standard of career and life, Iulia Tamas
20:00 - 20:30 How Technology fights Human trafficking (TraffickCam app), Aurelian Hadar

üë©‚Äçüíª Iulia Tamas, UX designer @ MicroFocus
I'm funny, kind, grateful, humble‚Ä¶ okay maybe not that last one. These are just a few of the words that represent who I strive to be.
I'm the mom of a wonderful little boy; the wife of my best friend and number one supporter; a daughter for my parents and in-laws; a friend for those who seek my friendship and also a UX designer.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam

venue.name: Google Hub Atelierul Digital pentru Programatori

events.description:
Flutter is Google‚Äôs portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

Agenda:
18:30 - 19:00 reception
19:00 - 21:00 Flutter Introduction & Write Your First Flutter App

Note:
1. We will use the ticket price to buy swags and food.
2. If you don't have PayPal account or you have problems with the payment please write us on Meetup (https://secure.meetup.com/messages/?new_convo=true) or Facebook (http://fb.com/gdgcluj).

events.name: GraphQL fundamentals with Flutter

venue.name: Google Hub Atelierul Digital pentru Programatori

events.description:
This workshop introduces you to GraphQL fundamentals and learn by integrating the APIs to a pre-built Flutter app. It also covers how to setup a GraphQL backend and how to use it to build apps.

We will follow a material built by Hasura team.

Key topics and takeaways:
- GraphQL vs REST
- GraphQL queries, mutations, subscriptions
- Setting up a GraphQL client
- Integrating GraphQL queries in your flutter app
- Integrating GraphQL mutations in your app to change data on the server
- Building a real-time feed with notifications using mutations and subscriptions
- Automatic updates to local state and UI after mutations

We will be building a realtime todo app using authenticated GraphQL APIs.

Please bring a personal laptop with Flutter SDK and an IDE installed. You can check our previous Flutter meetup for more details on that. (https://www.meetup.com/gdgcluj/events/262417640/)

We will use the ticket price to buy swags and food. If you don't have PayPal account or you have problems with the payment please write us on Meetup (https://secure.meetup.com/messages/?new_convo=true) or Facebook (http://fb.com/gdgcluj).
events.how_to_find_us: salƒÉ C03, parter, intrare prin spatele clƒÉdirii din dreapta

events.name: Flutter Interact Viewing Party
events.description:
Flutter is Google‚Äôs UI toolkit for building beautiful, natively compiled applications for mobile, web and desktop from a single codebase.

Join us for a day of creation and collaboration with the world, broadcasted live from Brooklyn NY.

With viewing parties around the world, everyone can be a part of this interactive event that focuses on sharing ideas, experimenting and crafting beautiful experiences across devices.

We‚Äôll showcase the latest from Google Design and Flutter, Google‚Äôs free and open source UI toolkit to build beautiful, natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop - all from a single codebase.

Flutter is Google‚Äôs portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Agenda:
18:30 - 19:00 reception
19:00 - 19:30 Watch Flutter Interact Keynote
19:30 - 20:00 Real life challenges of Flutter - a presentation about what does it mean to work with Flutter on a day to day basis
19:30 - 21:00 Dartpad Playthings Activity (codelab)

The presentation and codelab will be hosted by Tobias Heidingsfeld, an independent software developer for apps and games with nine years of experience. He tried various cross platform tools (Ionic, React native, Adobe AIR) and is working exclusively with Flutter since 1 year.

Note:
Bring a laptop! The codelab will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the codelab to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

group_profile.intro: Researcher. Passionate about Big Data and new technologies.
Senior Android Engineer & Project Lead @ Halcyon Mobile, speaker (Droidcon Berlin & Droidcon London ) whit an interest in blending AI Machine learning into mobile applications.
Full stack developer with interest in multiple languages and frameworks. Technology agnostic if it does the job :)
I‚Äôm a Functional Architect / Product Owner based in Cluj-Napoca working for  MicroFocus (past HP, HPE) on enterprise software products in the IT Operations Management field.
